title: THE FUTURE INFRASTRUCTURE
statements:
As an archive
I need attention
In order to understand why I exist

As a curious audience member
I need the ecosystem to be appealing, nicely designed (spacious/fun/translatable)
In order to enjoy using it/ browsing like in a gallery/museum (even if I 
m not an academic)

As an outside visitor
I need to be able to understand the language, images etc. that are presented to me
In order to be able to find my way in the archive

As a (first time) user
I need a search function that works in multiple ways (smart-search engines)
In order to find it relevant for my research practise

As a user
I need the ecosystem to be easy to navigate through
In order to love using it

As a consumerist
I need to not get what I want
In order to prevent self sufficient indifference & lack of curiosity

As a visitor/user
I need to be surprised about the possibilities I may encounter, intersectional cross-referencing
In order to find it relevant and informative for my research practises

As a chaotic person
I need a clean structure that gives an overview
In order to find the materials I’m looking for

As a browsing user
I need to be able to jump in at any point/to any point of the material
In order to explore

As a researcher
I need a space to work in private
In order to give ideas (and myself) the time they need

As a online tool
I need to be kept up to date
In order to understand my relevance

As a group of busy people
I need a lightweight form of sharing & communicating
In order to stimulate & sustain interconnectivity of exchange

As a neurodivergent person
I need this ecosystem to be/offer a physical space
In order to browse, absorb and encounter research of others in a material tactile physical form.
So I can be housed within it - a library bookshop dedicated to research projects - to display and organise

As a lover of planet earth
I need this sharing space to be sustainable, nonviolent & regenerative
In order to ensure that those contributing to it/involved in it
experience healthy relationships and practises for being careful ancestors and to stay alive

As a student maker
I need the material to be kept in a embodied form
In order to keep the movement

As a researcher
I need contact details of my fellow researchers/makers
In order to connect with people in my field, to communicate directly and potentially collaborate

As a coach for future creative producers
I need the ecosysteman with an interface that gives me new ideas and connections I haven't thought of before
In order to be able to use it to fuse my practise and use it as a valued source

As a researcher (always on the move and working from different places)
I need an ecosystem that is digital, interdisciplinary, and with a low threshold of access
In order to be able to use it to fuse my practise and use it as a valued source

title: SHARING KNOWLEDGE
statements:
As a researcher
I need a platform to share my research
In order to connect my content to others

As a lover of collective study
I need this ecosystem to offer space for collective thinking, doing, being, making, generating.
In order to keep life/ideas/things in movement and flow. And to not get stuck or fixed

As an institute
I need an online platform for the individual researches
In order to preserve them and to accumulate/create (new) knowledge

As a peer exchanged based curriculum
I need an easy accessible way to create & share a variety of forms of documentation
In order to support collective invention of research practises

As an artistic researcher
I need to get to know other artist and practitioners from other fields and their life experiences
In order to learn, experiment, rehearse, copy, blend authorship, get inspired and collaborate

As a maker
I need easy access to storages and archives (of schools/musea)
In order to connect to the past better and integrate the past in my work

As an institution
I need a form of cultivating practises that are open to external partners
In order to maintain a lively dialogue with the professional field & broader society

As a researcher/maker
I need access to works & programs of the past
In order to be able to situate artists/artistic practises in the context of their communities & influences

As a director of DAS Theatre
I need one workshop per year that deals with engaging with (live) performances by alumni
In order to connect different generations of students in an artistic way

As a 1st year student
I need to be able to watch the video’s of the recent graduates
In order to locate my position at school better, connect to peers, broaden the knowledge of our generation and connect to different generations

As a European based institution
I need access to participation from less privileged peers in the work
In order to overcome hegemonic blindness

As a language lover
I would like an evolving glossary of terms
In order to learn/share/play/evolve language

As a maker
I need a library of references used by others
In order to understand research better and draw inspiration

As a researcher
I need to be able to give and receive feedback
In order to further my research and thinking

As an alumnus
I need a place to share (and ask) things with the community
In order to find new connections, partners, colleagues

title: ARCHIVING
statements:
As a programme coordinator
I need an archive
In order to inspire me and understand the trajectory that we are building

As a archivist
I need a space with good conservative technology
In order to not lose fragile materials (digital and physical?)

As a non organised person
I need to have clear and easy methodologies of archiving work and personal thoughts
In order to be able to come back to them and develop them

As a archivist
I need to be able to edit my material, and have ways of opening up and activating my archive.
In order to continuously give meaning to the archive, to keep the research alive, and allow it to be of relevance

As a coach for future creative producers
I need an archive of processes, knowledge production and outcomes
In order to advise my students to share their own research

As a graduate student/researcher
I need to be able to design the archival format of my research work, where it fits the specificity of the research material
In order to make sure it resonates with the essence of the practice without the risk of misinterpretation

As a student
I need to learn about the importance of archiving as a political issue
In order to not reproduce power relationships

As a non-european archive
I need to be published
In order not to continue to be invisible

As a student maker
I need to archive the body
In order to keep it's knowledge in the original context

As a hoarder of information/ researcher
I need an automated random system that throws one of my archived documents back at me for review on a regular basis
In order to reconsider what I have & bring a game into my research & help me clean up my archive & trust in randomness as a research tool

title: MAKING
statements:
As a storyteller
I need to hear thoughts of others in the development part
In order to enrich my stories

As a dance practitioner
I need studio space & other dance practitioners
In order to create and get the embodied knowledge activated & shared

As a researcher
I need to be much more in the rehearsals of making artistic work (performances, theatre, installations)
In order to understand the generating of knowledge more up close

As a body based practices
I need forms of practising that are based upon lived experiences, sensitization of bodily senses
In order to prevent domination of screen based technologies

As a story lover
I need to be included in the research part of stories I consume
In order to really connect with them

As a student
I need to be stimulated with formats of writing as a poetical and choreographic language
In order to open up my way of writing

As a dance practitioner
I need communication strategies, scoring practises, narrating tools, poetic images
In order to invoke embodied experiences with others

As a student
I need methods and tools for documenting & reflecting on my process
In order to have more agency within my own education and understand the learning trajectory I have made

As a student
I need open space
In order to feel the freedom to explore

As a choreographer
I need to collect information from the public that saw my work
In order to add other perspectives besides my own

title: PUBLISHING
statements:
As a writer/artist
I need the end of the processes not to be a publication
In order to challenge me to spread knowledge in a different way and continue to take the act of publishing serious

As a book/image
I need to be read/shown
In order to understand why I’m there/to feel me

As a dancer
I need more yearly publications about dance that are playful, embodied and creative with language
In order to connect to the current developments in dance in a broad way

As a performer
I need more publications written from the point of view of a performer (not director)
In order to gain more knowledge about the receiving learning processes in artistic developments

As a child
I need publications about current artistic research in the form of children’s books
In order to multiply and translate artistic research to the next generation easily

As a researcher
I need to show my research
In order for it to exist beyond the academy

As a performer
I need to share public events
In order to reach additional research interested public/peers

As a peer/researcher
I need to be able to quickly see the current status of a research
In order to be kept up to date about the developments

title: INSTITUTE IDENTITY
statements:
As an institute
I need an alive platform
In order to make visible what we are doing and track our collective knowledge

As a student/maker
I need the institute to facilitate digital presence of my work
In order to have to rely on myself and the skills I have in transforming my material for others to encounter

As a visitor
I need to access information easily without bureaucracy
In order to not have to deal with control of the institution

As a student
I need more clear meeting points with other faculties
In order to connect better between departments

As a new member
I need an insight in the artistic history of the school and the past visions of the institution
In order to understand where its pedagogies are coming from, get inspired and position & deepen new visions

As a future student at DAS choreography
I need to know how the non-european students survived and how their personal daily experience was
In order to feel myself connect with a kind of (weird) heritage

As a student
I need a central portal where I can effectively communicate with all researchers
In order to connect better with my peers

As an alumnus
I need to be able to keep using the platform for ongoing research
In order to keep developing my work
